Author: joe2x4#5987
Content:
Maybe this is in the world of supply chain. But it would be great to see a system that connects small farmers with product manufacturers/distributors/end users via contracts for delivery that uses escrow, reputation, stable coins, and oracles.

Problem it solves, it would encourage small farmers to expand into new crops. It also provides a way for distributors and manufacturers to link with farmers and fill orders more effectively.

Content: MSME (Micro Small Medium Enterprise) hub is a great use case

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
Here's an example from EY
https://www.ey.com/uk/en/services/advisory/ey-case-study-informa

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
Most major consulting firms have case studies, this is likely the better approach for us. Businesses are often reluctant to try to implement solutions on their own and prefer to use consulting firms. Considering Komodo Antara is a tool set to custom make solutions, we should look to get consulting firms (of all sizes) to use Antara for their clients needs. 

Get them to produce their own case studies, offer workshops for consulting companies, etc

Author: Audo#5667
Content: We have gotten questions about why K64 was removed from the website, and we wanted to bring little clarity to it. Simly put, the situation is that Komodo team is awaiting more details and information to independently verify claims made by the Komodore64 team before we list them as an official ecosystem project.

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
I got a question that led me to give a general answer about what our marketing team is currently working on. Here's my quick update for transparency:

When it comes to what our marketing team is doing, there are three focus points:
 1) product/solution marketing, technical marketing, tech comparisons
 2) community portal and community strategy to increase community engagement
 3) educational journeys and tutorials (in collaboration with support/qa team)

Author: Rohit#0772
Content: and how to get username and password

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
for nspv, there is no username and password right now
you run the client locally and interact with it using curl commands or the builtin html wallet
example: 
```
curl --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "spend", "params": ["RFmQiF4Zbzxchv9AG6dw6ZaX8PbrA8FXAb",1 ] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:$port/
```
